stitch holder row 2-22 k 8 stitches bind off row 1 return the 8 unworked stitches to a needle so that the 1st stitch to be worked is at the inside edge of the leg join yarn and knit across 8 stitches row 2-22 k bind off knitting is complete here s sunrise here s sunrise side bear folded side bear laid out flat in half at the middle row of the head page �3 of 5 finishing if you re using safety eyes insert them before beginning to sew your stitch marker or pin is on the front of the bear sew up looking at the public side the two sides are reversible but you may prefer one to the other sew around the outside edges stitching through the space between the garter ridges when possible start at the feet and work up to the head on each side using the yarn tails leave the inside seam of one leg about halfway open to allow stuffing here s sunrise side bear unstuffed sewn up without his neck formed ears ears are satin-stitched into the top corners of the head locate a spot 1/4 to 1/2 inch / 1/2 -1 cm diagonally in and down from each head corner overstitch into that spot moving the yarn slightly with each stitch so that the ear fans out from that spot stuffing stuff the head and each part of the bear tightly with clumps of polyfill work the stuffing into the short row sections of the butt and belly as well as into the forehead the face short-row looks like a v and will guide positioning of facial features work polyfill into that section until you re satisfied with the look complete stuffing the bear while stitching up the leg opening neck using about 16 inches/40 cms of yarn starting at the mid-back section of the neck stitch around the neck once pull firmly & knot the yarn repeat drawing the neck in more tightly & knot the yarn again use the excess to fill in any holes where stuffing shows bury the yarn strands inside and trim any ends here s how sunrise bear looks stuffed with his neck formed page �4 of 5 face embroider a nose patch or triangle at the v-point of the
